meanings.definition: To shout or call out loudly to someone
meanings.sent1: She halloos to her friend across the playground.
meanings.sent2: The coach halloos instructions to the players on the field.
meanings.sent3: The little boy halloos for his mom when he can't find her in the store.
meanings.sent4: The protesters halloos their demands outside the government building.
meanings.sent5: The teacher halloos for silence before starting the lesson.

meanings.definition: A loud cry or shout to attract attention
meanings.sent1: The halloos of the lost hiker echoed through the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The sudden halloos from the crowd made everyone turn around.
meanings.sent3: The halloos of the excited fans filled the stadium.
meanings.sent4: The halloos of the children playing outside could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent5: The halloos of the protesters could be heard all the way to the city center.
